name: Start Node Process
description: Starts a managed Node.js process on the server from a given script file.

parameters.name: processId
parameters.description: A unique ID for the process (e.g., "aetherium_shard_1").

parameters.name: scriptPath
parameters.description: The path to the Node.js script to run, relative to the server's 'scripts' directory (e.g., "aetherium_server.ts").

purpose: To dynamically launch and manage server-side Node.js processes like game worlds or APIs.

name: Start Python Process
description: Starts a managed Python process on the server from a given script file, using the server's virtual environment.

parameters.name: processId
parameters.description: A unique ID for the process (e.g., "gazebo_service").

parameters.name: scriptPath
parameters.description: The path to the Python script to run, relative to the server's 'scripts' directory (e.g., "gazebo_service.py").

purpose: To dynamically launch and manage server-side Python processes like the Gazebo service or other automation scripts.

name: Stop Process
description: Stops a managed Node.js or Python process by its unique ID.

parameters.name: processId
parameters.description: The ID of the process to stop.

purpose: To terminate any running server-side process.

name: List Managed Processes
description: Lists all currently managed Node.js and Python processes running on the server.
purpose: To monitor and get the status of all running server-side processes.

name: Compile ESP32 Firmware
description: Compiles Arduino source code for an ESP32-S3 board using a server-side process. This is a simulation and requires arduino-cli to be configured on the server.

parameters.name: firmwareCode
parameters.description: The complete Arduino source code to be compiled.

parameters.name: boardFQBN
parameters.description: The fully qualified board name (FQBN) for the target device (e.g., "esp32:esp32:esp32s3").

purpose: To validate and prepare firmware for over-the-air (OTA) updates by compiling it on the server.

name: Flash ESP32 Firmware (OTA)
description: Flashes a compiled firmware binary to an ESP32 device over the air. This is a simulation and requires a Python OTA script on the server.

parameters.name: firmwarePath
parameters.description: The path to the compiled firmware binary on the server (e.g., "/tmp/build/firmware.bin").

parameters.name: deviceIp
parameters.description: The IP address of the target ESP32 device on the local network.

purpose: To deploy new firmware to a remote ESP32 device without a physical connection.
